author: Sid
content: You might also want to check hachoir toolkit at http://hachoir.org/ and in particular hachoir-metadata, dedicated to metadata extraction.

author: dex
content: pretty good article. Maltego is really a cool tool... looking forward for more info

author: BECN
content: exiftool http://www.sno.phy.queensu.ca/~phil/exiftool/ is a fantastic metadata discovery & altering perl based package that's also worth checking out

author: pdp
content: cool, 10x, I will check it out!

author: labmice from Greece
content:
Dear pdp, maybe you would like to have a look at Michal Zalewski's tool called "the revisionist" at http://lcamtuf.coredump.cx/strikeout/. The tool is located at http://lcamtuf.coredump.cx/soft/therev.tgz

Hope you find it interesting

Keep up the wonderful work :-)
labmice

author: pdp
content: labmice, 10x, I will check it out.

author: Laramies
content:
Cool post, i made a tool (metagoofil) that automates the whole process of downloading available public documents, processing metadata with libextractor, getting the interesting info, and creating a report.

You could check it here http://www.edge-security.com/metagoofil.php

Cheers

author: pdp
content: hi, I am aware of this tool. Cool stuff. I might need to implement something similar for my MET project which btw is way outdated. not enough time.
